title: Can't Create Folder in TB Client With Proton Accounts
content:
Greetings,

I had issues with creating folders in TB client with Proton Mail Account it would not create folders so Proton Support to try this if this would work,and it did resolver my issue.

If anyone is having issues,if you have a proton mail account with TB you may try this


(ProtonMail)

May 5, 2025, 12:57 GMT+2 Hello,

Thank you for your message.

In the Bridge, all folders are shown under the "Folders" group, and all your labels are shown under the "Labels" group.

This is because IMAP does not support labels, and they have to be shown as folders.

To create a folder or label, you need to create it under "Folders" or "Labels".

Can you try this and let us know if it will work?

Let us know if we can provide any further assistance.
creator: dabonz1965

title: Thunderbird can't reopen PDF attatchments after restarting
content:
Upgraded from 128 to 138 recently

Previously I would have an INBOX tab open and several pdf documents from attachments open using the inbuilt viewer.

After closing Thunderbird and restarting it at a later time my tabs would load the open pdf attachments.

Now it still has the tab open but isn't able to load the pdf attatchment. I get the message below:

The address wasn’t understood

One of the following (imap) is not a registered protocol or is not allowed in this context. 

You might need to install other software to open this address.

Address bar looks like this imap://my@mail.com.:993/fetch%3EUID%3E.INBOX%3E6339?part=1.4&filename=spec.of%20UFO-B%20series.pdf&type=application/pdf

Anyone have any ideas?

Thanks
creator: email.ilija.b

title: Out of Hard Disk Space - Corrupt iMap?
content:
Hi,

I'm getting low disk space available messages on my Windows 10 Pro PC.

Wiztree (see attached image) is showing 128gb in my imap.gmail.com folder.

Some time ago I started to get fairly regular popups about compacting my folders, which seemed to take an eternity without seeming to achieve too much, and I noticed that every time the TB application was shut down and restarted, the Inbox would show mails starting from 9/5/2022 every time (see attachment) and then gradually start to slowly load all more recent mails. In the lower left of application, is the message "Downloading message xxx of xx,xxx in Inbox" and it slowly counts away.

Around this time I had ine excess of 40,000 messages (many with attachments) and I began deleting all the larger attachment emails, and slowly started to cull older emails to where I now have 14,000.

The disk useage appears to have worsened over the past few months.

I'm thinking I have some sort of corruption in the database??

Please advise as to best way forward.

Thanks in anticipation, Peter
creator: monsoonhoy

title: Thunderbird crashed and deleted all emails from my inbox and webmail
content:
Dear All

Unfortunately Thunderbird crashed and deleted ALL my emails in my inbox, decades worth, and nothing in deleted folder. Same when checking on webmail. Sent, drafts, etc still have the emails present.

Oddly only some accounts were affected.

Please let me know if there is any way to recover the emails. This happened less than 35mins back.

Greatly appreciate any help.

FYI I tried the below but since missing on webmail as well I dont think this helps as when I check the file size is very small:

hunderbird stores your emails locally in a profile folder. Here's how to find it:

Open Thunderbird.

Go to: Menu (☰) > Help > More Troubleshooting Information

Scroll to "Profile Folder", and click "Open Folder" (on Windows) or "Show in Finder" (on Mac).

Once inside:

Navigate to: Mail > [Your Mail Server Name] > Inbox or for IMAP: ImapMail > [Your Mail Server Name] > Inbox

Look for files:

Inbox (no extension) – this is your actual email data.

What can I do to fix this?

Mike.

title: Blank Gray Screen after ""Allow" when trying to add Google Account
content:
I have been a Thunderbird user for over 10 years and recently my employer has started switching us over to Google Workspace emails. I'm trying to add the email to Thunderbird, but keep getting a blank gray screen (Image 2) in the Google pop-up after clicking "Allow" (Image 1). No error messages are displayed anywhere in the pop-up or in Thunderbird.

I have tried several times with no success. I've tried rebooting, same issue. I've tried disabling all the plugins in Thunderbird, same issue. I've let the screen sit there for over 20 minutes and nothing occurs. I even tried one-time hitting "Deny" and got the same blank screen.

As it is occurring inside Thunderbird itself, I have no way of telling what is going wrong. I know I am signing into my new Google account successfully as I wouldn't reach the page with "Allow".

Anybody know what I can do?

title: Adding comcast imap account errors with "either the password and address is wrong."  [was: incoming emails go directly to the "Junk" folder for no apparent reason (comcast)]f
content:
So, all of a sudden my incoming emails went directly to the "Junk" folder for no apparent reason. When I go to the Junk folder to view my emails, they don't show up in the right viewing column.

And when I try to send them back to my "Inbox," they don't go there and I have no idea where they go. I can't see them anywhere. I've checked my outgoing settings and they're where they are supposed to be....as well as my incoming server settings. They are where they should be. I use Comcast, and have checked with them, and those settings are correct

So at this point I have no idea what to do, and obviously need help from someone much more knowledgeable then me! Hopefully I've explained the issue clearly, and have made it easier for those of you out there. I'm not a computer dummy....but this has be quite baffled, as it came on suddenly, and had weird characteristics.

Thanks to all,

Michael...
